description: Machoke is a Stage 1 Fighting-type Pokémon that serves as the powerful middle evolution between Machop and Machamp. With 80 HP and two high-damage attacks, Machoke offers legitimate offensive threat despite being a transitional evolution. Karate Chop provides damage that decreases as Machoke takes hits, while Submission delivers consistent 60 damage at the cost of recoil. The high retreat cost and self-damaging mechanics create interesting strategic decisions around when to evolve and when to continue attacking.
competitiveHistory: Machoke saw moderate competitive play as part of Machamp evolution decks in the Base Set era. Unlike most middle-stage evolutions, Machoke was actually threatening enough to sometimes remain in play rather than being evolved immediately. The 50-60 damage output was competitive, though the self-damaging mechanics and Psychic weakness limited its appeal. Most tournament players preferred to use Pokémon Breeder to skip directly to Machamp, but Machoke could hold its own when forced into combat. It was generally viewed as one of the better Stage 1 evolutions, though still inferior to the final Machamp form.

rulings.ruling: Karate Chop does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke. For example, if Machoke has 2 damage counters (20 damage), Karate Chop does 50 - 20 = 30 damage.
No. If the calculation would result in 0 or less damage, Karate Chop simply does 0 damage.
Yes. Defender reduces all damage done to the Pokémon it's attached to, including self-damage from Submission. Submission would do 10 self-damage instead of 20.

Yes. Both Karate Chop (when undamaged) and Submission exceed 30 damage, so Mr. Mime's Invisible Wall prevents all damage from these attacks.
